thread.title: Jerry Jones: Nothing to Ezekiel Elliott domestic violence investigation
thread.title_full: Jerry Jones: Nothing to Ezekiel Elliott domestic violence investigation

author: Michael David Smith
title: Jerry Jones: Nothing to Ezekiel Elliott domestic violence investigation
text:
blessedunliketherest says: Mar 6, 2017 8:34 AM 
Nice tongue in cheek comment there at the end…”that suggests that the NFL’s investigations aren’t as independent as they should be” 
We all know this to be true. The NFL all but said investigations were not required to be independent when trying to frame Brady for causing NE to be cold in the winter. Mar 6, 2017 8:38 AM 
Jerry has his gold coat now. So he’s entitled. factschecker says: Mar 6, 2017 8:40 AM 
NFL owner by day, crime fighting private eye by night. 
Quincy sportoficionado says: Mar 6, 2017 8:41 AM 
Or that maybe the investigation yielded no results? it is now March 2017, this investigation had been ongoing for several months–with absolutely no tangible proof of any wrongdoing–when is it finally time to drop it? otheirony says: Mar 6, 2017 8:48 AM 
LOL…what do they actually do when they investigate? Talk about keystone cop wannabes…..how hard is this? Talk to the witnesses, if any, the main players, review any other evidence and make a decision. 
Clowns. The NFL front office and chief BOZO is one Roger Goodell. 
SMH deneb1973 says: Mar 6, 2017 8:51 AM 
“If that’s the case, that suggests that the NFL’s investigations aren’t as independent as they should be.” The Shield has been and continues to be battered (not tarnished) by the inept leadership provided by Goodell – favoritism coupled with childish refusal to consider contrary facts has led to the perception that the NFL has become rife with jealousy and fundamental unfairness but until ownership in Pittsburgh, NY Giants and Dallas are gored by the monster they have created this will continue to be the story. thegronk87 says: Mar 6, 2017 8:54 AM 
Jerry Jones: There is nothing to our super bowl aspirations either. Mar 6, 2017 8:55 AM 
We know all about the legendary “independent investigations” of the NFL…. bradygirl12 says: Mar 6, 2017 8:58 AM 
This reminds me of the Greg Hardy fiasco. “Nothing to see here, folks”, when actually, the guy WAS a loser. Skilled player, not so great person. Maybe Elliot is the same. Jerry may be in denial again. Mar 6, 2017 9:00 AM 
sportoficionado says: Mar 6, 2017 8:41 AM 
Or that maybe the investigation yielded no results? it is now March 2017, this investigation had been ongoing for several months–with absolutely no tangible proof of any wrongdoing–when is it finally time to drop it? 
——- ricko1112 says: Mar 6, 2017 9:09 AM 
As we saw during Deflategate, Spygate, Bountygate, Bullygate, KC’s “tampering” with Maclin, NJJ’s tampering with Revis, Ray Rice, Josh Brown, Luck, Sherman, and Bell not being listed on the injury report “investigations,” the NFL determines the outcome they want, then works backwards. Evidence, science, logic, and common sense not required. harrisonhits2 says: Mar 6, 2017 9:11 AM 
“The investigation has yielded absolutely nothing. We’ve successfully buried all evidence and protected another domestic violence abuser, just like the league normally does.” 
There, fixed his statement for him. 52crabcakes says: Mar 6, 2017 9:15 AM 
again the NFL does not care about domestic violence, females, males, fans, aliens, etc. They only care about the Benjamin! Whatever it takes. Nofoolnodrool says: Mar 6, 2017 9:19 AM 
“If that’s the case, that suggests that the NFL’s investigations aren’t as independent as they should be.” The Shield has been and continues to be battered (not tarnished) by the inept leadership provided by Goodell – favoritism coupled with childish refusal to consider contrary facts has led to the perception that the NFL has become rife with jealousy and fundamental unfairness but until ownership in Pittsburgh, NY Giants and Dallas are gored by the monster they have created this will continue to be the story. 
It only continues to be a story because the weak kneed male fans of the Patriots continue to whine about every utterance emanating from NFL HQ. Time for some testicular fortitude in New England. nhpats says: Mar 6, 2017 9:25 AM 
Maybe Jerry can tell us how the investigation into Andrew Luck’s broken ribs is progressing…. Nofoolnodrool says: Mar 6, 2017 9:29 AM 
“The investigation has yielded absolutely nothing. We’ve successfully buried all evidence and protected another domestic violence abuser, just like the league normally does.” 
There, fixed his statement for him. 
Another representative of CryBabyNation has posted their daily whine…..her day is now complete. Mar 6, 2017 9:41 AM 
Nofoolnodrool says: Mar 6, 2017 9:19 AM “If that’s the case, that suggests that the NFL’s investigations aren’t as independent as they should be.” The Shield has been and continues to be battered (not tarnished) by the inept leadership provided by Goodell – favoritism coupled with childish refusal to consider contrary facts has led to the perception that the NFL has become rife with jealousy and fundamental unfairness but until ownership in Pittsburgh, NY Giants and Dallas are gored by the monster they have created this will continue to be the story. 
It only continues to be a story because the weak kneed male fans of the Patriots continue to whine about every utterance emanating from NFL HQ. Time for some testicular fortitude in New England.
